Comment: Gibaud, against his fellow Frenchman Lazard, opens with a move that usually leads to a long, slow game... not this time!
Lazard responds with a Hypermodern move.
I fail to see the merits of this move... it seems to impede White's development...
Lazard plays to open up the game and exploit White's loss of time.
This horrific blunder ends things before they start!
Lazard doesn't miss the opportunity. If Gibaud tries to save his Queen with 5 PxN??? he runs into 5... Q-R5ch 6 P-N3 QxP mate. Gibaud resigns. This is the shortest master game on record!
